intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. nigrescens, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish to brownish, and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and is often found in temperate regions.
